entity.name: Requirement_collection_relationship
entity.description:
A
Requirement_collection_relationship
is a type of
that is used to relate a parent (collection) requirement to its member requirements. This provides a method for collecting together a set of requirements and treating them as a single requirement, whilst still being able to refer to individual requirements.
The inherited "relating_view" and "related_view" attributes have been renamed for purposes of clarity.

explicit.name: collection
explicit.description:
the
that the
Requirement_collection_relationship
identifies as a collection.
This atribute points to the view definition of the requirement which collects together the member requirements.

explicit.name: member
explicit.description:
the
that the
Requirement_collection_relationship
identifies as a member.
This attribute points to the view definition of a requirement which constitutes a part of the collection.

entity.name: Tracing_relationship
entity.description:
A
Tracing_relationship
is a type of
that shows tracing from (traces_from) one requirement to another (traces_to).
A requirement on the performance of a catalytic converter in a car may be traced from a more general emissions requirement.
A requirement may trace to many other requirements and vice versa - this is achieved by creating multiple instances of the tracing relationship entity.
The inherited "view_1" and "view_2" attributes have been renamed for purposes of clarity.
Properties may be attached to tracing relationships. This is intended to deal with "user defined" attributes which are common on tracing relationships in requirements tools.

explicit.name: traces_from
explicit.description:
the
that the
Tracing_relationship
traces from.
This attribute points to the view definition of the requirement which traces to another requirement.

explicit.name: traces_to
explicit.description:
the
that the
Tracing_relationship
traces to.
This attribute points to the view definition of the requirement which traces from another requirement.
